content: In the car analogy, the created car may have different Types of drivers. We create separate user manuals for them, an Average user manual, a Power user manual, a Child user manual, or a Handicapped user manual. Each type of user manual describes only those features/operations appropriate for the type of driver.  For instance, the Power driver may have additional gears to switch to higher speeds, that are not available to other type of users...
